question: 発見
sourceMnemonic: You make <kanji>departure</kanji> from your home off into the great beyond. You will go to <kanji>see</kanji> the unseen, and hopefully make a great <vocabulary>discovery</vocabulary>.
sourceReadingMnemonic:
This is a jukugo word, which usually means on'yomi readings from the kanji. You know the <ja>はつ</ja> part, which gets shortened to <ja>はっ</ja>. The <ja>見</ja> is unlike what you learned with <ja>見</ja>, though. 

In order to remember that this is <ja><reading>けん</reading></ja>, imagine you're going out to make a discovery of some strange new lands. With strange new lands, there comes strange new people. This one has a samurai named <reading>Ken</reading> <ja>けん</ja> on it. He's trying to discover new things too!
